alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 9:44AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 939 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain overnight has led to runoff in the Flat Creek Basin. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen so far, with an additional 0.75 to 1.5 inches possible with an additional round of showers and thunderstorms this afternoon into tonight. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway Y, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway C and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Exeter, Washburn, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Jenkins, Madry, Pleasant Ridge, Wheelerville, Wayne and Roaring River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
